channel.title: Dangerous global moderator permissions
channel.description: That www.meatspin.com thing that happened the other day got me thinking about what could have happened... As far as i know, there are heaps of g mods on this site. All of which seem to have "Administrate forum and database" privileges. I must ask why, because any of the mods could exploit this system, write a malicious package that erases all the database and install it to the forum, and theses nothing stopping this from happening. Yes, there's probably a backup, but that's not the point. Ban and user changing privileges are separate from that setting, so why do mods have administration privileges? Isn't that what the administrators are for?

item.title: Dangerous global moderator permissions
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Nice Bump.

Read full topic

item.title: Dangerous global moderator permissions
item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:15, topic:175260”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=235810.msg2010723#msg2010723 date=1201118000]
Well, from what I’ve heard… jdb or w/e made other people gmods, was he a gmod himself or was he made admin?
[/quote]

JDB`, being a Global Moderator had the ability to make other accounts, including accounts with Global Moderator Ability. Which, with that power, he made a bunch of accounts, and let some people get on them and wreak havoc on the forums. He had the ability as a Global Moderator. I assume the ability to make Gmods as a Gmod was put in place because people might get their accounts hacked, and would need a way to make a new account. Or maybe that setting was overlooked during the initial setup of the forums.[/quote]
As i haven’t been around here much…What the hell happened to him? Banned now eh?

[quote=“Uriko, post:8, topic:175260”]Why did you get off assuming they have access to the database?

The only thing I find weird is that gmods have the ability to create other gmods?[/quote]
That’s seriously screwed.

Read full topic

item.title: Dangerous global moderator permissions
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:175260”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=235810.msg2010588#msg2010588 date=1201088091]

The only thing I find weird is that gmods have the ability to create other gmods?

Uh… they do?
[/quote]

They shouldn’t have been able too, but they could, it has since been fixed manually.

Gmods can no longer do anything to hurt the forum that can’t be fixed with a few SQL queries. :)[/quote]
good shakes fist

Read full topic

@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Uriko:

Well, from what I’ve heard… jdb or w/e made other people gmods, was he a gmod himself or was he made admin?

JDB`, being a Global Moderator had the ability to make other accounts, including accounts with Global Moderator Ability. Which, with that power, he made a bunch of accounts, and let some people get on them and wreak havoc on the forums. He had the ability as a Global Moderator. I assume the ability to make Gmods as a Gmod was put in place because people might get their accounts hacked, and would need a way to make a new account. Or maybe that setting was overlooked during the initial setup of the forums.

[quote=“Lothy, post:11, topic:175260”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=235810.msg2009049#msg2009049 date=1201026334]
mods cant access the database, they are mods because they can be trusted (apparently)
[/quote]
Most of us can be trusted. I guess there’ll always be the chance to have a black sheep amongst an otherwise happy flock.[/quote]

The only thing I find weird is that gmods have the ability to create other gmods?
[/quote]
How did the g mod put the google thing into the word censor then? I thought you had to have administrate forum and database privileges to do that…[/quote]
There’s a word censor section in the admin panel, maybe?

[quote=“Mopman, post:10, topic:175260”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=235810.msg2010551#msg2010551 date=1201083631]
The only thing I find weird is that gmods have the ability to create other gmods?
[/quote]

Uh… they do?[/quote]

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman

@Mopman wrote:

Uhh… the way you just described how it should work is how it DOES work.

Gmods can’t install packages, or touch the database (except through ban+moderator UI).
